title.narrative: INVESTING IN HEALTH AND SYSTEM STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Ministry of Health at central and governorate levels have strengthened capacities for better resource mobilization, equitable distribution and efficient utilization through evidence based planning, proper implementation and close monitoring of maternal, neonatal and child health services, especially in the most vulnerable governorates., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, all newborns, children, adolescents and women in Iraq access and equitably use affordable, high-impact health and nutrition services, especially the most vulnerable in humanitarian situations.

participating-org.narrative: JOHN HOPKINS UNIVERSITY CENTER FOR COMMUNICATION PROGRAM

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Ministry of Health at central and governorate levels have strengthened capacities for better resource mobilization, equitabledistribution and efficient utilization through evidence based planning, proper implementation and close monitoring of maternal,neonatal and child health services, especially in the most vulnerable governorates.

description.narrative: Very limited funding and the distraction of government partners by the pandemic restricted activities included in the UNICEF 2020-21 Rolling Workplan. However,discussions on the commencement of the digitalization of the health information management system continued in 2021.Also, UNICEF funded workshops to improve finance management and budget capacity at sub-national levels. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:16/01/2022
